title: Skilled Workers and the Sabbath
summary: Exodus 31 describes how God appoints Bezalel and Oholiab to lead the construction of the tabernacle. It ends with a reminder to observe the Sabbath as a sign of the covenant. God then gives Moses the stone tablets.

faq.question: Who were Bezalel and Oholiab?
faq.answer: Two craftsmen chosen by God and filled with His Spirit to build the tabernacle and its furnishings.

faq.question: Why is the Sabbath emphasized here?
faq.answer: It is a sign of the covenant between God and Israel and a day of holy rest.
